Key Match Events: Alexis Mac Allister swept in a low finish three minutes after half-time to break the deadlock
Julian Alvarez doubled the lead in the 84th minute with a thumping shot from outside the area
Paulo Dybala put the seal on the victory with a late strike in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina, who also beat Chile 1-0 on their way to clinching back-to-back Copa America titles earlier this year, went into Thursday's game missing injured captain Lionel Messi and veteran winger Angel Di Maria, who retired from international football after the Copa America triumph in July.
Post-Match Reflections: Di Maria was feted by his former teammates at a pre-game ceremony before taking his place in the stands to watch the world champions secure their sixth win from seven qualifying games.
Despite his team's heavy loss, Venezuela coach Fernando Batista refused to dwell on the altitude issue after the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia reignited their campaign with a 4-0 drubbing over Venezuela in a game played more than 4,000m (13,100 feet) above sea level.

The result was a vindication of Bolivia's move to play Thursday's game in El Alto – Spanish for 'The Heights' – rather than at their usual home venue in neighboring La Paz, which is 3,600m above sea level.
